Gutierrez Romo Fernando

4064 Josefa Ortiz de Dominguez · Guadalajara, Jalisco, Mexico, CO 44820 · (+52) 3317466638 · fernandogromo517@gmail.com

Software Engineer with experience in backend development, mobile applications, and scalable architectures. Proficient in Golang, .NET Core, and Docker, with a strong background working in Agile environments. Focused on delivering efficient, maintainable, and reliable solutions.

Experience

Junior Software Developer

Núcleo de Diagnóstico
  • Developed a REST API in Go (Golang) to allow patients to securely access test results, integrating with Bootmaker for WhatsApp and the official website. Centralized patient information, studies, and laboratory areas.
  • Built a sample processing system in C# (.NET Core 8, MVP pattern) that automatically grouped laboratory studies, areas, and analytes from SIAN orders, generating labeled outputs to streamline laboratory workflows.
  • Contributed to the development of SIAN2 (backend), a core system for managing laboratory orders and results.
  • Supported development of the Human Capital (CH) system, enabling HR and Payroll teams to manage attendance, incidents, and employee records more efficiently.
  • Deployed and maintained backend services using Docker containers, Traefik for load balancing/routing, and React-based frontends.
  • Introduced and implemented an internal package (“Capyvel”) to standardize ORM and routing in Go services, improving maintainability and flexibility for future backend projects.
  • Designed database schemas and prepared UI mockups for stakeholder review before development.
  • Facilitated technical meetings to align requirements with development tasks and ensure delivery milestones.
October 2023 - August 2025

Software Development Intern

Comisión Federal de Electricidad (CFE)
  • Migrated a legacy C# desktop application to a Laravel web app, improving maintainability and accessibility.
  • Designed and deployed database schema (migrations, seeders, and data migration).
  • Deployed system on CFE’s local network via IISNode, ensuring secure and stable access.
  • Assisted with deployment and integration of an internal Node.js project.
March 2023 - September 2023

University Social Service

Universidad de Guadalajara (UDG)
  • Co-developed an Android app (Java, Android Studio) to read analog utility meters using the device camera and calculate consumption in real time.
  • Designed and trained a TensorFlow-based AI model to recognize numerical values from analog meters, integrated into the mobile app for offline usage.
  • Applied computer vision techniques with a partner to improve recognition accuracy through iterative model training.

Interests

Apart from being a web developer, I enjoy most of my time being outdoors. In the winter, I am an avid skier and novice ice climber. During the warmer months here in Colorado, I enjoy mountain biking, free climbing, and kayaking.

When forced indoors, I follow a number of sci-fi and fantasy genre movies and television shows, I am an aspiring chef, and I spend a large amount of my free time exploring the latest technology advancements in the front-end web development world.
